content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?> <metadata>     <idinfo>      <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>Minnesota Department of Natural Resources, Section of Wildlife</origin>         <pubdate>2004-04-19 00:00:00.0</pubdate>         <title catid="urn:noah:7739adc5-93d0-356a-8b21-a931fe39018f">State Wildlife Management Area Public Facilities - points</title>         <mgmg1cid></mgmg1cid>           <pubinfo>             <publish>Minnesota DNR - Section of Wildlife</publish>           </pubinfo>         <onlink>http://deli.dnr.state.mn.us/</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </citation>      <descript>       <abstract>This point theme contains facilities and features for WMAs that are best represented as points.  WMAs are part of the Minnesota state recreation system created to protect wildlife habitat and provide wildlife-based recreation.  Facilities and features are labeled based on a hierarchical classification system developed by the MN DNR, Section of Wildlife.  Several examples of  features that may be represented as points include parking lots, water access, signs, gates, bridges, camping facilities, blinds, water control structures, feeding structures, nesting and breeding structures, buildings, reference points and cultural features.   Disclaimer: The only features in this theme are WMA user facilities such as parking lots, water accesses, trails and blinds.  WMA management facilities such as water control structures, restricted roads, gates and habitat structures have been removed from this layer.</abstract>       <purpose>Wildlife staff will use the WMA point facilities and features layer for managing wildlife habitat on WMAs; local mapping, contracting for maintenance and development projects, visitor use maps, management use maps, project planning and acquisition planning. The layer will also be used for public information about the public use facilities that can be found on WMAs. WMAs are included in the Recreation Compass on the DNR web site, which can be accessed by the public to print maps of public use facilities found on a particular WMA.</purpose>       <supplinf>Minnesota</supplinf>     </descript>      <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>April 2004</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>Digitizing of current WMA facilities and features should be finished statewide some time this summer. WMA facility and feature alterations and facilities and features of new WMA acquisitions will be updated on an annual basis every winter.</current>     </timeperd>      <status>       <progress>In Work</progress>       <update>Annual</update>     </status>          <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-97.5</westbc>         <eastbc>-89</eastbc>         <northbc>49.5</northbc>         <southbc>43</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>      <keywords>       <theme>         <themekey>Public Use Facilities, User Facilities, Management Facilities, Features, transportation</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekey>Minnesota, Wildlife Management Areas, WMA, WMAs, Wildlife Lands, State Lands</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>      <accconst>No special restrictions beyond those described in the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement</accconst>     <useconst>No special restrictions beyond those described in the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement</useconst>          <ptcontac>       <cntinfo>         <cntperp>           <cntper>Steve Benson</cntper>           <cntorg>DNR - Fish and Wildlife</cntorg>         </cntperp>         <cntpos>GIS Coordinator</cntpos>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype>           <address>1201 East Hwy 2</address>           <city>Grand Rapids</city>           <state>MN</state>           <postal>55744</postal>         </cntaddr>         <cntvoice>(218) 327-4149</cntvoice>         <cntfax>(218) 327-4263</cntfax>         <cntemail>steve.benson@state.mn.us</cntemail>       </cntinfo>     </ptcontac>      <browse>       <browsen>http://jmaps.dnr.state.mn.us/gis/dp_datasample.jsp?mpid=39000396&ptid=2&fcid=3&lname=State Wildlife Management Area Public Facilities - points</browsen>       <browsed></browsed>     </browse>      <native>ArcView 3.3</native>          <crossref>       <citeinfo>         <title></title>       </citeinfo>     </crossref>    </idinfo>     <dataqual>      <attracc>       <attraccr>Source table FCIL_WMAPBPT3.DBF:  The program project codes designating WMAs have been identified accurately. Facility or feature classification is verified by Area Wildlife Staff.  Other attributes have varying levels of accuracy. </attraccr>     </attracc>      <logic>Data are topologically correct using ArcView 3.x.</logic>     <complete>Facilities and features are nearly complete for most of the state. Facilities and features that are not complete and verified are not included in this database.   Note: The only features in this theme are WMA user facilities such as parking lots, water accesses, trails and blinds.  WMA management facilities such as water control structures, restricted roads, gates and habitat structures have been removed from this layer.</complete>          <posacc>       <horizpa>         <horizpar>Source layer fcil_wmapbpt3:  No Assessment at this time </horizpar>       </horizpa>       <vertacc>         <vertaccr>Source layer fcil_wmapbpt3:  Not Applicable </vertaccr>       </vertacc>     </posacc>           <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srcscale>Source layer fcil_wmapbpt3:  24000 </srcscale>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc>Attribute Lineage for source table FCIL_WMAPBPT3.DBF:  Area Wildlife staff used the MN DNR, Section of Wildlife, Facilities/Features Classification System to code facilities on the DOQ maps or by populating the attribute table in ArcView.  Other facility attributes were filled out with the assistance of the "Wildlife Management Area/Geographic Information System Project Standards".  For area offices that drew on maps, GIS specialists heads up digitized facilities or features and then populated the attribute table in ArcView. </procdesc>       </procstep>     </lineage>
